metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19377 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystem image, performing some operations, and unmounting can lead to a use-after-free in btrfs_queue_work in fs/btrfs/async-thread.c. It was discovered that the btrfs implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly detect that a block was marked dirty in some situations. An attacker could use this to specially craft a file system image that, when unmounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Exploiting this vulnerability requires a crafted filesystem image to be mounted
